summary: This document is a series of T-Mobile phone bill pages showing itemized call details for an account from August to November 2004. It shows frequent calls between Miami, FL, New York, NY, and other locations, with many calls marked as mobile-to-mobile. The document appears to be part of financial records related to the Epstein case, likely used to establish communication patterns and travel. This document is a T-Mobile phone bill itemizing call details for an account from October 20 to November 22, 2004. It shows frequent calls between Miami, FL, New York, NY, and other locations, with numerous incoming calls and specific charges for services like 'Dir Asst' (Directory Assistance). This document is an itemized telephone bill for a T-Mobile account, covering calls from November 22, 2004, to January 11, 2005. It details call destinations, times, durations, and charges, showing frequent calls to and from locations associated with Jeffrey Epstein, including New York, NY; Miami, FL; West Palm Beach, FL; and the U.S. Virgin Islands. The bill is part of the financial records collected in the investigation. This document is a series of T-Mobile phone bill itemizations covering January to March 2005, detailing call logs, messaging, and charges. It shows frequent calls between Miami, FL; New York, NY; West Palm Beach, FL; and other locations, with many calls marked as mobile-to-mobile. The document appears to be financial evidence, likely related to tracking communications in the Epstein case. This document is a series of itemized telephone billing statements for a T-Mobile account, covering February to April 2005. It details numerous calls to and from locations associated with Jeffrey Epstein, including New York, NY; Miami, FL; West Palm Beach, FL; and international calls to Poland. The records show frequent calls to a 'Dir Asst' (likely a direct assistant line) and patterns of communication between key locations. This document is a series of T-Mobile phone bill itemizations for an account, detailing call logs, messaging, and charges from April to June 2005. It shows frequent calls to/from locations associated with Jeffrey Epstein (New York, NY; Miami, FL; Palm Beach, FL) and international texts to Poland, providing a record of communication patterns during this period. This document is a T-Mobile phone bill detailing itemized call and messaging activity for an account from June 11, 2005, to July 19, 2005. It shows numerous calls to and from locations associated with Jeffrey Epstein, including New York, NY; Miami, FL; West Palm Beach, FL; and other cities. The bill includes charges for calls, text messages, and service fees. This document is an itemized telephone bill for a T-Mobile account, covering usage from July 9 to July 31, 2005. It details numerous incoming and outgoing calls to locations including New York, Miami, Palm Beach, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, which are relevant to the travel patterns and communications of individuals in the Epstein case.

events.title: Telephone Activity Period
events.description: A period of extensive telephone activity recorded on a T-Mobile account, showing numerous calls to and from locations associated with Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.

locations: St. Croix/Charlotte Amalie, VI (U.S. Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The document is a detailed phone bill from T-Mobile covering August to November 2004.
It shows a high volume of calls, primarily between Miami, FL and New York, NY, with many marked as mobile-to-mobile (Call Type F).
The account incurred minimal charges, with a total of $1.98 for the September period and $2.24 for the October period shown.
Calls were also placed to and from various other locations, including Grant, NE; Queens, NY; and several Florida cities.
The document is labeled as part of the Epstein case data set (EFTA00007401 series), indicating it was likely entered as evidence or part of a financial investigation.
The document is a detailed phone bill covering October 20 to November 22, 2004.
It shows a high volume of calls, particularly between Miami, FL and New York, NY.
Numerous calls are listed as 'Incoming' or 'Mobile to Mobile' (F).
Specific charges are itemized for 'Dir Asst' (Directory Assistance) at $1.25 per call.
The bill includes a text message sent to Poland on November 15, 2004.
The document is a detailed T-Mobile phone bill spanning from November 22, 2004, to January 11, 2005.
Call records show high frequency of calls to/from locations central to Epstein's operations: New York City, Miami, and West Palm Beach.
Several calls are noted as 'Mobile2Mobile' (type F), indicating calls between cell phones, possibly between associates.
Calls are made to and from the U.S. Virgin Islands (St. Croix/Charlotte Amalie), a location of interest in the Epstein case.
The bill includes charges for services like 'Dir Asst' (Directory Assistance) and international text messages, providing a pattern of communication activity.
The document is a detailed phone bill from T-Mobile for an account, covering January to March 2005.
It shows a high volume of calls, primarily between Miami, FL and New York, NY, with many calls marked as mobile-to-mobile (F).
Other frequent call destinations include West Palm Beach, FL, San Rafael, CA, and Marion, OH.
The bill includes messaging charges, with text messages sent to Poland noted in January 2005.
The document is labeled as part of the Epstein case files (EFTA00007401.pdf), suggesting it was entered as evidence, likely to establish communication patterns or contacts.
The phone records span from February 21, 2005, to April 9, 2005, showing a high volume of calls.
Frequent calls are made to and from locations central to Epstein's operations: New York, NY; Miami, FL; and West Palm Beach, FL.
Multiple calls are logged to a 'Dir Asst' (Direct Assistant) line, incurring a consistent charge of $1.25, suggesting a dedicated assistant or service line.
International calls were made to Poland on specific dates: 2/22/05, 3/05/05, 3/10/05, and 3/18/05.
The account includes calls to the U.S. Virgin Islands (Charlotte Amalie) on 3/29/05, a location where Epstein owned property.
The document is a detailed T-Mobile phone bill covering April to June 2005, showing call destinations, times, durations, and charges.
Frequent call destinations include Miami, FL; New York, NY; and West Palm Beach, FL—locations central to Epstein's residences and operations.
Multiple text messages were sent to Poland during this period, indicating international communication.
The bill shows a pattern of numerous incoming and outgoing calls, including mobile-to-mobile calls and calls to a 'Dir Asst' (likely directory assistance).
The account was subject to itemized billing with detailed breakdowns of airtime, toll charges, messaging charges, and taxes.
The phone bill covers the period from June 11, 2005, to July 19, 2005, showing frequent communication activity.
Calls were frequently made to and from locations strongly associated with Jeffrey Epstein's residences and operations: New York, NY; Miami/West Palm Beach, FL.
The bill shows calls to 'Dir Asst' (likely a directory assistance service) and multiple incoming calls, suggesting high-volume usage.
International text messages were sent to Poland on several dates in June 2005.
The document is a standard itemized phone bill, providing a log of communications that could be used to establish patterns of contact or location during the billing period.
The document is a detailed T-Mobile phone bill dated August 20, 2005, covering the period July 9-31, 2005.
Call destinations include New York City, Miami, Palm Beach, and Charlotte Amalie in the U.S. Virgin Islands—locations central to Epstein's residences and activities.
The bill shows a high volume of incoming calls and calls to directory assistance, suggesting active use of the phone line for coordination and travel arrangements.
The document is labeled as part of a larger set (EFTA00007498 to EFTA00007500), indicating it is one piece of financial evidence collected in the investigation.
